intro: Serratula albarracinensis, commonly known as the Albarracín goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its yellowish to reddish flower color. Serratula albarracinensis has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers. It is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
